units.name: Unit 1: Analyze text with Azure AI Language

questions.question: What is the first step to use Azure AI Language service?
options: Provision an Azure AI Language resource
questions.answer: Provision an Azure AI Language resource
questions.explanation: ✅ You need to provision the managed Language resource before using any API :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}. Others don’t enable service usage.

questions.question: Which HTTP header is required to call Text Analysis API?
questions.explanation: ✅ The REST API requires apim subscription header :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}. 'Bearer' works only with OAuth but not primary.

questions.question: Which tasks are supported by the analyze-text endpoint? (Select 4)
questions.explanation: ✅ The REST `analyze-text` supports detection, extraction, sentiment, entities, and linking :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}. Machine Translation is separate.

questions.question: Scenario: You need to find the main topics in user reviews. Which task do you choose?
questions.explanation: ✅ Key phrases identify the main ideas; entity linking connects entities; sentiment handles mood.

questions.question: What sentiment labels are returned by the service?
questions.explanation: ✅ Comprehensive sentiment includes Mixed along with positive, neutral, negative :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT output from detect-language?
questions.explanation: ✅ Language detection returns ID, code, confidence; does not perform translation.

questions.question: Scenario: Analyze text in French. What property should you set?
questions.explanation: ✅ CountryHint helps language detection when text is such; language property isn’t available at input.

questions.question: What does entity linking produce?
questions.explanation: ✅ Linking returns candidate entities with reference links such as Wikipedia sources.

questions.question: Which SDK would you install for Python text analysis?
questions.explanation: ✅ That is the official Python SDK; others don’t exist or are outdated.

questions.question: Module assessment: True or False — You can perform multiple tasks (like sentiment and key phrases) in one call.
questions.explanation: ✅ `analyze-text` supports batching multiple analysis tasks in a single request :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}.

questions.question: What confidence range does sentiment API return?
questions.explanation: ✅ Confidence values are normalized from 0 to 1 :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}.

questions.question: How many characters per document are supported in standard plan?
questions.explanation: ✅ The limit per document is 5,120 characters :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}.

questions.question: Scenario: You only want opinion sentiment about 'battery'. What should you use?
questions.explanation: ✅ Opinion mining extracts sentiment associated with specific aspects like 'battery' :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}.

questions.question: Which property groups sentence opinions under targets?
questions.explanation: ✅ Opinion mining structures results under sentenceOpinions array :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}.

questions.question: Which task type finds PII entities like SSNs?
questions.explanation: ✅ Entity Recognition includes hidden PII types when specified; linking connects entities to Wikipedia.

questions.question: Coding: In C# SDK, which method runs AnalyzeText?
questions.explanation: ✅ That is the pattern used in SDK samples :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}.

questions.question: Why use Language Studio over REST?
options: No code UI to test tasks
questions.answer: No code UI to test tasks
questions.explanation: ✅ Language Studio provides UI experience without writing code; pricing and network aren't distinguishing factors.

questions.question: Which output includes a confidence score per sentence?
questions.explanation: ✅ Sentiment scores are returned per sentence and document.

questions.question: Scenario: Calling REST API you get 429. What happened?
questions.explanation: ✅ HTTP 429 indicates rate limiting; others are 401, 404, or 413 respectively.

questions.question: What does linked-entity provide that entity-recognition doesn’t?
questions.explanation: ✅ Linked entities include knowledge base links, entity types and matches; recognition gives type and text only.

questions.question: Module assessment: True or False — Language detection returns a single language only.
questions.explanation: ✅ The service returns a single dominant language per document.

questions.question: Which REST parameter sets model version?
questions.explanation: ✅ In REST body you specify \"parameters\": {'modelVersion':'latest'} :contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}.

questions.question: What metadata appears in response if showStats=true?
questions.explanation: ✅ DocumentStatistics with character/token counts are returned when stats enabled :contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}.

questions.question: Which SDK supports opinion mining explicitly?
questions.explanation: ✅ The main SDK supports opinion mining; others not supported or deprecated.

questions.question: Which limitation applies to batch size?
questions.explanation: ✅ The service supports up to 1,000 documents per batch.

units.name: Unit 2: Create question answering solutions with Azure AI Language

questions.question: What is the primary goal of the question answering capability in Azure AI Language?
options: Build conversational Q&A over your data
questions.answer: Build conversational Q&A over your data
questions.explanation: ✅ Question answering adds a conversational layer over data for Q&A applications :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}. Others are unrelated.

questions.question: What is the difference between QnA Maker and custom question answering?
options: Custom QnA uses a deep learning ranker and multi-turn support
QnA Maker supports active learning, custom QnA doesn’t
questions.answer: Custom QnA uses a deep learning ranker and multi-turn support
questions.explanation: ✅ Custom QnA adds enhanced ranking, multi-turn, region support :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}. Options 1 and 4 are false; 3 is backwards.

questions.question: Which step is required before creating a knowledge base?
questions.explanation: ✅ Custom QnA relies on Azure Search index for knowledge base search :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}.

questions.question: What document source types are supported for QnA projects? (Select 2)
questions.explanation: ✅ Supports unstructured docs such as PDF, URL, DOCX. Others aren’t supported :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}.

questions.question: What is multi‑turn conversation?
questions.explanation: ✅ Multi-turn supports conversational refinement via follow-up prompts :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}.

questions.question: Scenario: User asks 'My account', what enables guided follow-ups?
options: Multi-turn prompts pulled from the KB
questions.answer: Multi-turn prompts pulled from the KB
questions.explanation: ✅ Follow-up prompts in KB guide the next steps :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}.

questions.question: How do you add follow-up prompts in Language Studio?
questions.explanation: ✅ Studio UI provides Answer & Prompts editor :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}.

questions.question: Which REST response property contains follow-up widgets?
questions.explanation: ✅ Prompts array appears under `context.prompts` :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}.

questions.question: What is active learning in Q&A?
options: Suggesting alternate user questions based on real queries
questions.answer: Suggesting alternate user questions based on real queries
questions.explanation: ✅ Active learning provides suggestions to improve knowledge base :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}.

questions.question: Which triggers active learning?
options: Strong ranking delta between top answers
questions.answer: Strong ranking delta between top answers
questions.explanation: ✅ When top answers have close scores, suggestions generate :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}.

questions.question: How often are active learning suggestions generated?
options: Every 30 minutes when 5 similar queries cluster
questions.answer: Every 30 minutes when 5 similar queries cluster
questions.explanation: ✅ According to clustering behavior in QnA Maker documentation :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}.

questions.question: After suggestions, what must you do to apply changes?
options: Accept/reject suggestions, Save and Train, Publish
questions.answer: Accept/reject suggestions, Save and Train, Publish
questions.explanation: ✅ Workflow requires approval, training, publishing :contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}.

questions.question: Coding: In C# using Azure.AI.Language.QuestionAnswering, which method gets multi-turn answers?
questions.explanation: ✅ That method returns context for multi-turn Q&A.

questions.question: Which client UIs support multi-turn conversation testing?
questions.explanation: ✅ Studio provides interactive testing :contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}.

questions.question: What distinguishes active versus implicit learning?
options: User selects between close answers vs algorithm clusters scores
Active is manual, implicit is automated login
questions.answer: User selects between close answers vs algorithm clusters scores
questions.explanation: ✅ Active uses explicit selection; implicit uses internal score differences :contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}.

questions.question: Which feature adds conversational personality to the KB?
questions.explanation: ✅ Chit‑chat adds conversational small talk :contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}.

questions.question: Scenario: Bot responds too formally. How to add warmth?
questions.explanation: ✅ Personas provide tone/styles; others irrelevant :contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}.

questions.question: Module assess: True or False — You need to publish the KB to enable multi-turn in clients.
questions.explanation: ✅ KB must be published so clients can consume its endpoints.

questions.question: What security boundary ensures your Q&A project is protected?
options: Azure resource + Azure Search & managed identities
questions.answer: Azure resource + Azure Search & managed identities
questions.explanation: ✅ Project is secured via resource integration and identity.

questions.question: Which REST query parameter sets the user ID for active learning?
questions.explanation: ✅ API requires userId parameter for session context :contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}.

questions.question: Scenario: You need support for German and English Q&A. How configure?
questions.explanation: ✅ Multi-language projects set at project creation :contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}.

questions.question: What does layered ranking refer to?
questions.explanation: ✅ First search layer, then NLP ranker orders results :contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}.

questions.question: Coding: Which SDK package do you install in Python to use custom Q&A?
questions.explanation: ✅ That’s the official Python package for custom question answering.

questions.question: What is a ‘project’ in custom Q&A?
options: Encapsulates KB, sources, multi‑turn, active learning
questions.answer: Encapsulates KB, sources, multi‑turn, active learning
questions.explanation: ✅ Project bundles all features from source to consumable endpoint :contentReference[oaicite:20]{index=20}.

questions.question: Which action is NOT covered by active learning?
questions.explanation: ✅ Active learning improves KB, doesn’t impact chat flow.
